Sentencas: Donor-doped perovskite-type SrTiO3 experiences stoichiometric changes at high temperatures in different P-o2 involving the formation of Sr or Ti-rich impurities.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: NiO is incorporated into the stoichiometric strontium titanate, SrTi(0.8)Nb(0.2)O(3-)d (STN), to form an A-site deficient perovskite material, (NiO)(0.05-)(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)(0.95) (Ni-STN), for balancing the phase transition.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Metallic Ni nanoparticles can be released upon reduction instead of forming undesired secondary phases.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This material design introduces a simple catalytic modification method with good compositional control of the ceramic backbones, by which transport property and durability of solid oxide fuel cell anodes are largely determined.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Using Ni-STN as anodes for solid oxide fuel cells, enhanced catalytic activity and remarkable stability in redox cycling have been achieved.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrolyte-supported cells with the cell configuration of Ni-STN-SDC anode, La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.87Mg0.13O3 (LSGM) electrolyte, and La-0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3 (LSCF) cathode produce peak power densities of 612, 794, and 922 mW cm(-2)at 800, 850, and 900 degrees C, respectively, using H2 as the fuel and air as the oxidant.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Minor degradation in fuel cell performance resulted from redox cycling can be recovered upon operating the fuel cells in H-2.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Such property makes Ni-STN a promising regenerative anode candidate for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Releasing Metal Catalysts via Phase Transition: (NiO)0.05-(SrTi0.8Nb0.2O3)0.95 as a Redox Stable Anode Material for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
